meanings.sent1: She is an electable candidate for the student council.
meanings.sent2: The popular student was considered electable for the class president position.
meanings.sent3: The class clown joked that even the school mascot would be more electable than him.
meanings.sent4: In the world of superheroes, Batman is the most electable vigilante for justice.
meanings.sent5: The shining knight in armor was the most electable hero in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Suitable or likely to be chosen by voters in an election.
meanings.sent1: His policies make him an electable candidate for mayor.
meanings.sent2: The experienced senator was seen as the most electable choice for president.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a dog running for president may sound funny, but some believe it could be electable.
meanings.sent4: Her charisma and charm make her an electable leader in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent5: The passionate speaker proved to be the most electable candidate during the debate.
